page.title: 12TRAFFIC CONGESTION/BY-PASS
page.content: Okehampton stands on the A30 trunk road, direct route to Cornwall from the rest of the U.K. For much, apart from the heavy lorries, traffic flows through without notice. Summer week -end traffic congestion brings the A30 to a standstill. Holiday makers, locally known as 'grockles', often sit and wait for the privilege of passing through the town. Sometimes the queues are up to seven miles long (picture). A by-pass was first suggested in the 1920's. After a number of public inquiries and much local debate Oke. still has no by-pass. Two routes have been suggested, one to the north of the town through farmland, and one to the south across the edge of the National Park. The latter requires an act of parliament and has upset many conservationist. Most towns people just want a by-pass.
